cont.entity_a: Started to rust after a few months despite being labeled as stainless steel. Prone to water spots that cannot be removed if not dried properly.
cont.entity_b: Blade oxidized and discolored after first washing.

cont.entity_a: Brittle and prone to chipping over time. Holds an edge fairly well and is sharp out of the box. Some users experienced blade fragility.
cont.entity_b: Top edge is very sharp and can cut hands easily. The blade is sturdy and holds the edge well. Sharpness is not as expected and requires frequent sharpening. Good knife for the price but lacks edge retention. Edge retention is poor and requires regular sharpening. Edge retention is phenomenal and requires minimal maintenance.

cont.entity_a: Integrated forged handle that won't break off. Handle is too small for larger hands, causing discomfort. Handle grip can be slippery when wet.
cont.entity_b: Handle can become discolored and cracked. Handle is squared and uncomfortable for prolonged use. Ergonomic handle and good weight balance. Handle is lighter than expected and affects balance.

cont.entity_a: Retains its edge well. The knife is very sharp and versatile for various tasks.
cont.entity_b: Sharpness is not as expected and requires frequent sharpening. Knife is sharp and slices cleanly through various foods.

cont.entity_a: Lightweight and cuts through food with ease.
cont.entity_b: Blade weight distribution is slightly heavier.

cont.entity_a: Convex bevel shape contributes to ease of use.
cont.entity_b: Made in India, not up to German standards.

cont.entity_a: Not recommended for cutting through bones.
cont.entity_b: Knife is sharp and well-balanced for general use.
The knife is not made in Spain as advertised but in China.
